name: Raksha Demon Mask
village: Fierce protective demon mask with bulging eyes and protruding fangs
shortDescription: The Raksha mask is one of the most powerful and visually striking masks in Sri Lankan tradition. It represents fierce demon figures from ancient folklore who protect against evil spirits and disease. The mask features dramatically bulging eyes that symbolize supernatural vision and the ability to see into the spirit world. Protruding fangs represent the power to devour evil forces. The elaborate cobra hood decorations indicate divine energy and connection to serpent deities.
carvingTools: Used in Sanni Yakuma devil-dancing ceremonies to drive away illness by embodying and controlling malevolent spirits. The dancer transforms into a supernatural being.
significance: Raksha masks combine pre-Buddhist animistic beliefs with later Buddhist and Hindu influences creating a unique Sri Lankan healing tradition spanning over 2000 years.
culturalBackground: The mask channels the demon's power to heal patients through ritual performance. The fierce appearance frightens away disease-causing spirits.

name: Gurulu Bird Mask
village: Mythical bird-demon mask with distinctive beak and ornate feathered crown
shortDescription: The Gurulu mask depicts the mythical bird-king from Hindu-Buddhist mythology combining avian and demonic features. It represents Garuda the eternal enemy of nagas (serpents). The distinctive hooked beak allows for dramatic sound effects during performances. The elaborate feathered crown indicates royalty among spirit beings. Multiple eyes painted around the mask symbolize omniscience and the ability to see in all directions simultaneously.
carvingTools: Dual purpose mask for entertainment in Kolam dance-drama and serious healing in exorcism rites. The bird demon serves as messenger between human and spirit worlds.
significance: Gurulu represents a mythical demon-bird appearing in both Kolam folk drama and Sanni Yakuma healing rituals bridging entertainment and sacred ceremony across cultures.
culturalBackground: The mask serves as messenger between realms carrying prayers to deities and returning with blessings. It also treats respiratory illnesses through sympathetic magic.

name: Naga Raksha Mask
village: Cobra demon mask with multiple serpent hoods radiating dramatically from face
shortDescription: The Naga Raksha represents the powerful serpent deities of Sri Lankan and South Asian mythology. Multiple cobra hoods (traditionally 7 or 9) radiate from the central face creating a stunning visual of supernatural power. Each cobra head is individually detailed with scales hood patterns and fierce expressions. The mask connects to ancient Naga worship predating Buddhism representing fertility earth energy and the underworld realm.
